definition: Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to compete with (idiom) (Tw)/to pit oneself against

sentences.english: I think I had glimmerings of this perception many years ago when I was a graduate student.
sentences.chinese: 我想我是在多年前读研究生时有了这种想法的苗头。

sentences.english: Tight credit could suppress any rebound in spending, furthermore.
sentences.chinese: 此外，信贷紧缩可能抑制开支复苏苗头。

sentences.english: Even in our small example, we can see this just beginning to happen.
sentences.chinese: 即使在我们这样小的示例中，也可以看到混乱的苗头。

sentences.english: It is early days, but those who see a leftward tilt have a case.
sentences.chinese: 尽管为时还早，但那些看出左倾苗头的人也不无理由。

sentences.english: Already, there are early signs of drought in the northern wheat-growing areas, Mr. Liu said.
sentences.chinese: 刘宁说，北方小麦产区已经出现了早期的干旱苗头。

sentences.english: “Threats have a hard time hiding in a calm environment, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “危险苗头在平静的环境中难以产生，”他说。

sentences.english: Just as the timber war wound down, the tanker war began.
sentences.chinese: 但木材之争刚刚平息下来，油轮对抗又冒出了苗头。

definition: omen/sign (that sth is about to happen)/warning sign
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
to sprout (lit. or fig.)/to bud/to germinate/germ/seed/bud
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
to check/to contain/to hold back/to keep within limits/to constrain/to restrain
